Shadowcaster turned around to face Blackfang, relieved
that someone with some degree of maturity had come on
the scene.

"Finally a bot in this room who isn't acting like a
spark that came online 2 nanoclicks ago." he says this
shhoting acusing liooks at Kup, Windlord and at
Kitkat.

Noticing that Blackfang seems concerned as to her
safety, he decided to reassure him.

"Don't worry, while I had a vice like grip on her
while trying to get her to cool her cylanders, I
didn't damage her." 

Then feeling a little humor was required, he adds with
a somewhat surprisingly flippent tone,

"Don't worry Fang, as Ravage once said to Wheeljack,
if I wanted her dead, she'd be paperclips by now."

 --- Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote: 
---------------------------------
Blackfang arrived and decided it was best to take
thing on himself - 
not that he didn't trust Shadowcaster, but he did find
his ways a 
bit drastic.

Blackfang: Thanks Shade, and you too, guys (he nods at
Windlord and 
Kup). If you allow, I can take care of her.

He then looks at KitKat. She did not seem okay, at
least not in her 
processors, and he felt pity towards her. He looks in
her eyes.

Blackfang: Hello KitKat... Do you remember me?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Polar Claw
<cycodrone@y...> wrote:
> When he saw she'd calmed down, he places her gently
on

> Preadcon- by the way, did you ever consider that
maybe
> it's you who hates the matrix?"
>

> wrote: 
> ---------------------------------
> KitKat::
> 
> She was too startled to make sence of this huge bot
> who just picked 
> her up.  She transformed into wolf mode and started
> scrambling to get 
> out of his arms. "LET ME GO! I KNEW YOU WOULD TRY TO
> TORTURE ME! "  
> SHe struggled and squirmed trying to get out of his
> grip. "MAXIMALS 
> ARE AS TRETCHEROUS AS PREDACONS!"  She struggled
hard,
> but his grip 
> was firm.  She stopped as she felt her body reach
low
> energy levels. 
> She looked up at him as she lay in his arms, "Go
> ahead, kill me. Send 
> me to the pit for all I care. I'll just come back
> again. The matrix 
> hates me. So I shall never know peace." She was
still
> in wolf mode 
> and taking deep breaths. She almost felt like
crying,
> but a warrior 
> can never show true emotion or they show they are
> weak. She wimpered 
> once and then stopped. She lay still and waited for
> the bot to crush 
> her.  
> 
>

everyone

And

have
